verses.verse: Then Moses <S%H4872><s%> and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> sang <S%H7891><s%> this song <S%H7892><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H559><s%> "I will sing <S%H7891><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> for he has triumphed <S%H1342><s%> gloriously. <S%H1342><s%> The horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider <S%H7392><s%> he has thrown <S%H7411><s%> into the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

Yah <S%H3050><s%> is my strength <S%H5797><s%> and song. <S%H2176><s%> He <S%H2088><s%> has become my salvation. <S%H3444><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is my God, <S%H410><s%> and I will praise him; <S%H1><s%> my father's God, <S%H430><s%> and I will exalt him. <S%H7311><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> of war. <S%H4421><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is his name. <S%H8034><s%>

He has cast <S%H3384><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s chariots <S%H4818><s%> and his army <S%H2428><s%> into the sea. <S%H3220><s%> His chosen <S%H4005><s%> captains <S%H7991><s%> are sunk <S%H2883><s%> in the Red <S%H5488><s%> Sea. <S%H3220><s%>
The deeps <S%H8415><s%> cover <S%H3680><s%> them. <S%H3381><s%> They went down into the depths <S%H4688><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> a stone. <S%H68><s%>

Your right hand, <S%H3225><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> is glorious <S%H142><s%> in power. <S%H3581><s%> Your right hand, <S%H3225><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> dashes the enemy <S%H341><s%> in pieces. <S%H7492><s%>

In the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of your excellency, <S%H1347><s%> you overthrow <S%H2040><s%> those who rise up against <S%H6965><s%> you. <S%H7971><s%> You send forth your wrath. <S%H2740><s%> It consumes <S%H398><s%> them as stubble. <S%H7179><s%>

With the blast <S%H7307><s%> of your nostrils, <S%H639><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> were piled <S%H6192><s%> up. <S%H5140><s%> The floods stood upright <S%H5324><s%> as a heap. <S%H5067><s%> The deeps <S%H8415><s%> were congealed <S%H7087><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

The enemy <S%H341><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H7291><s%> 'I will pursue. I will overtake. <S%H5381><s%> I will divide <S%H2505><s%> the spoil. <S%H7998><s%> My desire <S%H5315><s%> shall be satisfied <S%H4390><s%> on them. <S%H7324><s%> I will draw my sword, <S%H2719><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> shall destroy them. <S%H3423><s%>'
You blew <S%H5398><s%> with your wind. <S%H7307><s%> The sea <S%H3220><s%> covered <S%H3680><s%> them. <S%H6749><s%> They sank like lead <S%H5777><s%> in the mighty <S%H117><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

Who is like you, <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh, among the gods? <S%H410><s%> Who is like you, <S%H142><s%> glorious in holiness, <S%H6944><s%> fearful <S%H3372><s%> in praises, <S%H8416><s%> doing <S%H6213><s%> wonders? <S%H6382><s%>
You stretched out <S%H5186><s%> your right hand. <S%H3225><s%> The earth <S%H776><s%> swallowed them. <S%H1104><s%>

"You, <S%H2617><s%> in your loving kindness, have led <S%H5148><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> that <S%H2098><s%> you have redeemed. <S%H1350><s%> You have guided <S%H5095><s%> them in your strength <S%H5797><s%> to your holy <S%H6944><s%> habitation. <S%H5116><s%>
The peoples <S%H5971><s%> have heard. <S%H8085><s%> They tremble. <S%H7264><s%> Pangs <S%H2427><s%> have taken hold <S%H270><s%> on the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Philistia. <S%H6429><s%>

Then <S%H227><s%> the chiefs <S%H441><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%> were dismayed. <S%H926><s%> Trembling <S%H7461><s%> takes hold <S%H270><s%> of the mighty men <S%H352><s%> of Moab. <S%H4124><s%> All the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> are melted away. <S%H4127><s%>

Terror <S%H367><s%> and dread <S%H6343><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on them. <S%H1419><s%> By the greatness of your arm <S%H2220><s%> they are as still <S%H1826><s%> as a stone <S%H68><s%>â€” until your people <S%H5971><s%> pass over, <S%H5674><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> until the people <S%H5971><s%> pass over <S%H5674><s%> who <S%H2098><s%> you have purchased. <S%H7069><s%>

You shall bring <S%H935><s%> them in, <S%H5193><s%> and plant them in the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of your inheritance, <S%H5159><s%> the place, <S%H4349><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> which you have made <S%H6466><s%> for yourself to dwell in; <S%H3427><s%> the sanctuary, <S%H4720><s%> Lord, <S%H136><s%> which your hands <S%H3027><s%> have established. <S%H3559><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> shall reign <S%H4427><s%> forever <S%H5703><s%> and ever. <S%H5769><s%>"

For the horses <S%H5483><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> went in <S%H935><s%> with his chariots <S%H7393><s%> and with his horsemen <S%H6571><s%> into the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> brought back <S%H7725><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> on them; <S%H1121><s%> but the children of Israel <S%H3478><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> on dry <S%H3004><s%> land in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

Miriam <S%H4813><s%> the prophetess, <S%H5031><s%> the sister <S%H269><s%> of Aaron, <S%H175><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> a tambourine <S%H8596><s%> in her hand; <S%H3027><s%> and all the women <S%H802><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> after <S%H310><s%> her with tambourines <S%H8596><s%> and with dances. <S%H4246><s%>

Miriam <S%H4813><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> them, <S%H7891><s%> "Sing to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> for he has triumphed <S%H1342><s%> gloriously. <S%H1342><s%> The horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider <S%H7392><s%> he has thrown <S%H7411><s%> into the sea. <S%H3220><s%>"

Moses <S%H4872><s%> led Israel <S%H3478><s%> onward <S%H5265><s%> from the Red <S%H5488><s%> Sea, <S%H3220><s%> and they went out <S%H3318><s%> into the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Shur; <S%H7793><s%> and they went <S%H3212><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> and found <S%H4672><s%> no water. <S%H4325><s%>

When they came <S%H935><s%> to Marah, <S%H4785><s%> they couldn't <S%H3201><s%> drink <S%H8354><s%> from the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Marah, <S%H4785><s%> for they were bitter. <S%H4751><s%> Therefore its name <S%H8034><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Marah. <S%H4785><s%>
The people <S%H5971><s%> murmured <S%H3885><s%> against Moses, <S%H4872><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "What shall we drink? <S%H8354><s%>"

Then he cried <S%H6817><s%> to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> showed <S%H3384><s%> him a tree, <S%H6086><s%> and he threw <S%H7993><s%> it into the waters, <S%H4325><s%> and the waters <S%H4325><s%> were made sweet. <S%H4985><s%> There he made <S%H7760><s%> a statute <S%H2706><s%> and an ordinance <S%H4941><s%> for them, <S%H5254><s%> and there he tested them;

and he said, <S%H559><s%> "If you will diligently <S%H8085><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> and will do <S%H6213><s%> that which is right <S%H3477><s%> in his eyes, <S%H238><s%> and will pay attention to his commandments, <S%H4687><s%> and keep <S%H8104><s%> all his statutes, <S%H2706><s%> I will put <S%H7760><s%> none of the diseases <S%H4245><s%> on you, <S%H7760><s%> which I have put on the Egyptians; <S%H4714><s%> for I am Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> who heals you. <S%H7495><s%>"

They came <S%H935><s%> to Elim, <S%H362><s%> where there were twelve <S%H8147><s%> springs <S%H5869><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> and seventy <S%H7657><s%> palm trees: <S%H8558><s%> and they encamped <S%H2583><s%> there by the waters. <S%H4325><s%>
